channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [PIG-4047] Break up pig withouthadoop and fat jar
item.description:
pig-withouthadoop jar is packaging pig core and pig core dependencies. But this jar should be removed due to following items:
1. the name is confusing. User did not know what the jar is used for at a glance.
2. it is not absolutely clear for user what the core dependencies are.
3. it is hard to maintain dependencies, like dependencies version update. Maybe user want to try different version avro without repackaging.

It is better to not use pig-withouthadoop jar, instead:
1. devided without hadoop jar into pig core and pig core dependencies.
2. save jars in 1# in lib directory
3. in pig script, always add all the jars in lib directory into classpath and add pig core jar into classpath.
I used pig in this way since version 0.8.1 via launching pig grunt. No issue found yet.

Current branch-0.13 is packaging following jars into pig-withouhadoop jar:
<include name="antlr-runtime-$

{antlr.version}

.jar"/>
<include name="ST4-$

{stringtemplate.version}

.jar"/>
<include name="jline-$

{jline.version}

.jar"/>
<include name="jackson-mapper-asl-$

{jackson.version}.jar"/>
<include name="jackson-core-asl-${jackson.version}

.jar"/>
<include name="joda-time-$

{joda-time.version}

.jar"/>
<include name="guava-$

{guava.version}

.jar"/>
<include name="automaton-$

{automaton.version}

.jar"/>
<include name="jansi-$

{jansi.version}

.jar"/>
<include name="avro-$

{avro.version}.jar"/>
<include name="avro-mapred-${avro.version}

.jar"/>
<include name="trevni-core-$

{avro.version}.jar"/>
<include name="trevni-avro-${avro.version}

.jar"/>
<include name="snappy-java-$

{snappy. version}

.jar"/>

We could save upper jars and pig-core jar into lib directory.
item.summary: Break up pig withouthadoop and fat jar

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
test-patch result:
[exec] -1 overall.
[exec]
[exec] +1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.
[exec]
[exec] -1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
[exec] Please justify why no tests are needed for this patch.
[exec]
[exec] -1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.
[exec]
[exec] +1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.
[exec]
[exec] +1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs warnings.
[exec]
[exec] +1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

fang fang chen, your idea works. There is couple of more changes. I attached another patch.

Pig will ship direct dependencies to backend (antlr, automaton etc). However, we will also need to ship loader specific jars. Eg, AvroStorage should ship all avro jars. This can be addressed in a separate Jira.

Also note this will serve the base for PIG-4011.

Also need to do svn mv:
svn mv lib/jdiff src/docs/jdiff

Don't include jdiff part since it will overwhelming the size of patch.

Further remove fat pig.jar. Instead, put hadoop 1 libraries in lib/hadoop1 in distribution.

Note most of changes here will become irrelevant after mavenization (PIG-2599). But I don't want to depend on PIG-2599 for that. Also this might simplify mavenization since now we don't need to use maven shade to build uber-jar.

Hi Daniel,

I found you added jar-h12/package-h12/tar-h12 for the new design. Found following problems:
1. Seems hadoop 2 part is not included in PIG-4047-2.patch. I also find lib/hadoop1 when -Dhadoopversion=23.
2. When not using hadoopversion tag, both pig*-h1.jar and pig*-h2.jar are generated. I assume only pig*-h1.jar should be generated. I mean in default mode, hadoop version is 20.

I have some questions, please give a glance.
1. If my cluster is using mapreduce 1.* and hdfs 2.*. What value of hadoopversion should be?
2. Could you tell which branch will this fix be included?
3. Will pig also follow the same design after mavenization(PIG-2599)? I mean remove fat jar and without hadoop jar.
4. could you tell what do you mean by saying "uber-jar"?

Thanks

Thanks for trying. Let me first explain what does the patch does:
1. Original jar target still works, but it only builds pig.jar (h1 or h2 depends on hadoopversion), and copy dependencies to lib
1. Use tar-h12 for Apache release, it would bundle:

  • pig-h1.jar, pig-h2.jar: Pig core jar compiled for H1 & H2
  • lib: Pig dependent libraries extract Hadoop, include two parts: core dependencies which Pig would need at runtime; convenient dependencies which user may use when using some UDF
  • lib/hadoop1: Hadoop 1 runtime. It is only used in local mode in case user don't have local hadoop installation

I don't see the problem you mentioned when I build it locally with PIG-4047-2.patch
1. You mean lib/hadoop2? I don't bundle hadoop2 runtime. I only bundle hadoop1 runtime in case user don't have local hadoop installation. It does not seems necessary to bundle 2 Hadoop runtimes. And it only happens when doing tar-h12.
2. If no hadoopversion is specified, only pig-h1.jar would be generated

Now answer your questions:
1. Actually I didn't think about this case. How does it work before?
2. This will be in trunk, and will be hopefully in 0.14.0
3. I believe so
4. "uber-jar" means a jar wraps other jars, such as pig-withouthadoop.jar, which not only contains pig classes, but also wraps antlr-runtime.jar, automaton.jar, etc.

Thanks for explain.
For our mapreduce 1.* and hdfs 2.* hadoop cluster, I generated pig tar with no hadoopversion is specified. I assume the default version would be 20. As I thought the most common connection between pig and hadoop is at mapreduce side. Please help correct me if I was wrong.
Till now, one issue was found and was fixed at hadoop side. I am not sure whether some potential issues existed.

Do you have any concern if we did like this? I mean generated pig package with no hadoopversion specified and running this package in hybrid hadoop, that is mapreduce 1.* and hdfs2.*.
Or could you describe some test cases for me to test?

Thanks
That probably Ok since HDFS API is relatively stable, but we never tested this scenario before.

Hi Daniel,

Is PIG-4047-2.patch the final fix for this? I want to backport this patch based on branch-0.13, and not sure whether you will make any further improvement.

Thanks
Yes, this is the final fix unless there are comments from other reviewers,

Few comments:

  • pig pom file might require some changes to explicitly specify dependencies as pig-withouthadoop.jar is split up now. I don't see a pig.pom in trunk anymore. Haven't checked how it has been the pom file is produced now, but it would be good to check once if that works fine.
  • I am wondering if we should still keep the pig-withouthadoop.jar for some time giving folks time to migrate (For eg: In oozie now you will have to copy more jars instead of just the pig-withouthadoop.jar). Getting rid of the fat pig.jar is ok. The new jar should probably be called pig-core.jar so that after mavenization we can have pig-tez.jar and pig-spark.jar.
  • I like the idea of lib, lib/hadoop1 and lib/hadoop2. What other jars are produced in the base directory apart from pig.jar? Aren't dependent jars under lib. 
    +        <fileset dir="${pig.dir}">
+            <include name="*.jar"/>
+        </fileset>
Cheolsoo Park, can you check if this will affect Genie?
Daniel Dai, thank you for checking. No, this won't affect Genie since it simply assumes that Pig is installed in PIG_HOME and invokes bin/pig. I like what you're doing here!

Addressing Rohini Palaniswamy's review comments:

  • pig pom file
    This should be a separate issue. Even without this change, we need to fix it. Let me create a ticket
  • Keep the pig-withouthadoop.jar
    Put it in legacy directory in the new patch
  • What other jars are produced in the base directory apart from pig.jar?
    Fixed
Patch committed to trunk. Thanks Rohini for review and fang fang for initiating the work!

Daniel Dai, ant clean eclipse-files -Dhadoopversion=23 started failing with the following error after this commit-

BUILD FAILED
/Users/cheolsoop/workspace/pig-apache/build.xml:329: /Users/cheolsoop/workspace/pig-apache/lib does not exist.

Do you know why?
Sorry didn't test eclipse-files. Attach PIG-4047-4.patch for it.
+1 for PIG-4047-4.patch. Thank you for the quick fix!
PIG-4047-4.patch committed. Thanks Cheolsoo!
